CommonFields.Publication: Composites Part A: Applied Science and Manufacturing
CommonFields.Title: Thermo-mechanical properties of randomly oriented carbon/epoxy nanocomposites
Author: Fidelus, J.D.
Wiesel, E.
Gojny, F.H.
Schulte, K.
Wagner, H.D.
CommonFields.Location: Department of Materials and Interfaces, Weizmann Institute of Science, 76100 Rehovot, Israel

Mixing.Description: Epon 815/T-403 epoxy mixed in a 100:43 ratio

MoldingInfo.Description: The mixtures were then cast into a rectangular RTV mold (50 mm * 5 mm * 0.8 mm^3).

Scanning_Electron_Microscopy.Description: A thin layer (about 3 nm) of chromium was sputter-coated on the SEM specimens, which were mounted onto a standard SEM holder with conducting carbon tape.

DynamicProperties.Description: The samples were tested in the 0–130 degree C temperature range, at a heating rate of 3 degree C/min in air and at a frequency of 10 Hz.
The samples were tested in the 0–130 degree C temperature range, at a heating rate of 3 degree C/min in air and at a frequency of 10 Hz.
